message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DS

The paper discusses a protocol for remote attestation of smart devices in IoT scenarios, which involves security and networking aspects. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also deals with communication and computation efficiency, which suggests the category cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The protocol is designed to work with unstructured or dynamic topologies, which relates to the category cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper proposes a consensus-based approach, which is relevant to the category cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the simulations used to validate the protocol involve large-scale networks, which is a characteristic of the category cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
